required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Midostaurin Efficacy and Safety in Newly Diagnosed Patients With FLT3-mutated AML
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Randomized, Double-blind, Multi-center, Placebo-controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Twice Daily Oral Midostaurin in Combination With Daunorubicin/Cytarabine Induction, High-dose Cytarabine Consolidation, and Midostaurin Single Agent Continuation Therapy in Newly Diagnosed Patients With FLT3-mutated Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML).

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of midostaurin in combination with daunorubicin/cytarabine induction, high dose cytarabine consolidation and midostaurin single agent continuation therapy in newly diagnosed patients with FLT3-mutated acute myeloid leukemia (AML).

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Safety Events (Part 1, Japan only)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 21 of the first Consolidation cycle
primary_outcome.description: Incidence and severity of Safety Events, defined as death or serious adverse event leading to treatment discontinuation that occurs on or before Day 21 of the first Consolidation cycle. This is is determined by the Independent Safety Committee to be definitely or probably related to midostaurin.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 years after last patient started treatment
primary_outcome.description: Event Free survival defined as the time from the date of randomization until an EFS event is observed. An EFS event is defined as a failure to obtain a CR within an induction 2, relapse after CR, or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 years after last patient started treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival defined as the time from the date of randomization to date of death due to any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 years after last patient started treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Complete Remission defined as the proportion of patients with a CR according to Chelson Criteria, at various timepoints

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 years after last patient started treatment
secondary_outcome.description: CIR (only for patients who have achieved CR after study treatment initiation), is measured from the date of first CR to relapse or death due to AML, whichever occurs first.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Induction 1 Cycle 1 Day 8, Day 11, Day 15, Day 18 and Day 21, Consolidation Cycle 1 Day 8, Day 21, Cycle 3 Day 8, Day 21 Prior to first cycle of continuation cycle 1, Continuation Cycle 5, Continuation Cycle 9 and Completion Cycle 12
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the pharmacokinetic of major metabolite of midostaurin CGP52421

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Induction 1 Cycle 1 Day 8, Day 11, Day 15, Day 18 and Day 21, Consolidation Cycle 1 Day 8, Day 21, Cycle 3 Day 8, Day 21 Prior to first cycle of continuation cycle 1, Continuation Cycle 5, Continuation Cycle 9 and Completion Cycle 12
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the pharmacokinetic of major metabolite of Midostaurin CGP62221.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life (QoL) per European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) QLQ-C30
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, D21 of each cycle of Induction and Consolidation; D1 of each cycle of Continuation, at end of treatment and during the post treatment follow up every 4 months during the first year
secondary_outcome.description: EORTC)QLQ-C30 total score and functional scales scores as determined by the score and absolute change from baseline at each scheduled assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life (QoL) per Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: D21 of each cycle of Induction and Consolidation; D1 of each cycle of Continuation, at end of treatment and during the post treatment follow up every 4 months during the first year
secondary_outcome.description: PGIC score determined frequencies and percentages by scheduled timepoint.

arm_group.description: Patients will take study drug on day 8-21 during induction and consolidation phase; then continuously during continuation phase.
Patients will take placebo on day 8-21 during induction and consolidation phase; then continuously during continuation phase.

intervention.description: Midostaurin 50 mg [two 25 mg capsules] will be administered twice per day by mouth on day 8-21 during induction and consolidation phase; then continuously during continuation phase
Placebo two capsules will be administered twice per day by mouth on day 8-21 during induction and consolidation phase ; then continuously during continuation phase.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of AML (≥ 20% blasts in the bone marrow based on WHO 2016 classification). Patients with APL (acute promyelocytic leukemia) with PML-RARA are not eligible
- Documented presence of an ITD and/or TKD activating mutation in the FLT3 gene, as determined by analysis in a Novartis designated laboratory An exception will be patients who are enrolled into the part 1 in Japan, who may be treated with midostaurin irrespective of AML FLT3 genotype.
- Patients must meet the following laboratory value criteria that indicate adequate organ function at the screening visit:
- Estimated creatinine clearance ≥ 30 ml/min
- Total bilirubin ≤ 1.5 x ULN, except in the setting of isolated Gilbert syndrome
- Aspartate transaminase (AST) ≤ 3.0 x ULN
- Alanine transaminase (ALT) ≤ 3.0 x ULN
- Suitability for intensive chemotherapy in the judgment of the investigator
Exclusion Criteria:
- Neurologic symptoms suggestive of CNS leukemia unless CNS leukemia has been excluded by a lumbar puncture. Patients with CSF fluid positive for AML blasts are not eligible
- Developed therapy-related AML after prior radiotherapy (RT) or chemotherapy for another cancer or disorder
- Known hypersensitivity to midostaurin, cytarabine or daunorubicin or to any of the excipients of midostaurin/placebo, cytarabine or daunorubicin
- Abnormal chest X-ray unless the abnormality represents a non-active, or non-clinically significant finding, such as scarring (subjects with controlled non active lung infection are eligible)
- Known impairment of gastrointestinal (GI) function or GI disease that might alter significantly the absorption of midostaurin
- Cardiac or cardiac repolarization abnormality
- Pregnant or nursing (lactating) women
- Women of child-bearing potential, unless they are using highly effective methods of contraception during dosing and for 4 months after stopping medication Other protocol-defined Inclusion/Exclusion criteria may apply.

patient_data.ipd_description: Novartis is committed to sharing with qualified external researchers, access to patient-level data and supporting clinical documents from eligible studies. These requests are reviewed and approved by an independent review panel on the basis of scientific merit. All data provided is anonymized to respect the privacy of patients who have participated in the trial in line with applicable laws and regulations. This trial data availability is according to the criteria and process described on www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com
